revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=D-Link |model=DIR-100 |revision=B1 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date=03/2010 |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |manuf=Alpha Networks |manuf_model=RG-10 |manuf_rev= |availability=no longer sold |type=router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1.2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5.5 |pwr_barrel_inner=1.5 |pwr_barrel_len=10 |pwr_pol=normal |cpu1_brand=WavePlus |cpu1_model=WP3221 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=1 |fla1_brand=Eon |fla1_model=EN29LV800CB-70TIP |fla1_num= |ram1=8 |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model=M12L64164A-7TG |ram1_num= |jtag=none |serial=yes,, 3.3V TTL |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass= |oui_eth=F0:7D:68 }} '''Ethernet Broadband Router''' - ''Triple Play Router'' *The ''D-Link DIR-100'' is a wired router with 1x WAN and 4x LAN ports. :D-link issued firmwares for the DIR-100 with different features: router, :802.1q VLAN management switch and "Triple Play Router" (router and IP media receiver). *The DIR-100 may be configured via HTTP, telnet or serial port using CLI :(Common Language Interface, example: http://pastie.org/pastes/2115436). * Documentation, firmwares and other may be found in [ftp://ftp.dlink.ru/pub/Router/DIR-100/ D-Link FTP archive (RU)]. === Description === *OEM ''Alpha Networks'' model ''RG-10'' :"8RG10....2A1G" and a date code of ''1010'' (March 2010) is silkscreened on the board. * The SoC used is in a QFP package w/ 128 pins, a firmware string of :"Waveplus" would seem to indicate the device uses a [[WavePlus]] SoC.. :which I am assuming is WP3221 (there appears to be a datasheet of the chip [http://d1.amobbs.com/bbs_upload782111/files_16/ourdev_457680.pdf here]) * RAM chip is 1M x 16 Bit x 4 Banks, frequency 143 MHz, look at the [http://www.esmt.com.tw/DB/manager/upload/M12L64164A.pdf M12L64164A datasheet]. * Flash chip is 8 Mbit with an access time of 70 ns. === Serial === TTL 3.3V serial port. :Speed: 115200 baud, data bits: 8, parity: none, stop bit: 1, flow control: none. ==== Pinouts ==== JP1 is the serial port. {| border="1" |1|| ||2||3||4 |} #RX #+3.3V #Ground #TX ==== Ports ==== {|cellpadding=2 !bgcolor=#c0c0c0|Label on case |bgcolor=#c0c0c0| LAN4 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0| LAN3 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0| LAN2 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0| LAN1 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0| WAN |- !bgcolor=#c0c0c0|Internal name |bgcolor=#c0c0c0 align=center| P0 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0 align=center| P1 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0 align=center| P2 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0 align=center| P3 |bgcolor=#c0c0c0 align=center| P4 |} ==== Boot log ==== Console output: 
WP3221 Rev 01

SDRAM TD: 03,  Bus: 16,  Bank: 02,  Row: 0c,  Col: 
08,  CS: 1
SDRAM Size: 0x00800000
Zz
WP3220 LOADER V1.5.26 20071030,D-Link
Ver  : 0.1.5.26
EthIf: 1
Run  : flash
BUF  : 10140000 SIZE=70000 SRC=a0010000
MAC  : F0:7D:68:5A:89:68 F0:7D:68:5A:89:69 00:DE:AD:BE:EF:FC 
VLAN : 0
HwVer: 0.1.2.3
SerNo: 12345678

IP/NM/GW: 192.168.0.1/255.255.255.0/192.168.0.67
TFTPS:FILE: 192.168.0.67:boot_sdtst_td3.img
NET BUF: b03ec000, 2KB x 16
progmac: 20:D9:20:D9:20:D9
if322x_init: done

Run  : flash  [Y] 
loading 0x7d690 bytes from a0010000 to 0x10140000
Goto 0x10140000!!!
Next does OS boot. == Images == {| border="0" cellpading="4" |- |[[File:DIR100rB1 2.png|thumb|Back view]] |[[File:DIR100rB1 3.png|thumb|Disassembled]] | |- |[[File:DIR100rB1 4.png|thumb|Board top view]] |[[File:DIR100rB1 6.png|thumb|Board bottom view]] |[[File:Dir100B1-CPU.jpg|thumb|CPU]] |- |}[[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::label| ]] __NOTOC__
